title: I think Jerry Seinfeld is a brilliant comedian, but I didn't think his show was funny. Am I the only one who thinks this way about rude people? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, you’re not alone. Moreover, on that show, Seinfeld was the least funny of the characters. He was Abbott in Abbott and Costello, or Larry in the Three Stooges. But to your question, there’s no doubt that being a dick detracts from one’s comedic bona fides. One of the greatest comedic geniuses, Don Rickles, known as “Mr. Warmth” for his schtick of being hostile and insulting, always ended his act by showing that after all … he was just kidding! Seinfeld, on the other hand, was just pretending to be Mr. Nice, and just like that slob, Rosie O’Donnell, the “Queen of nice,” he didn’t fool anyone.

Jerry Seinfeld is a brilliant comedian, because he had the confidence to allow the 2nd, 3rd and 4th banana to get laughs. He copied the Jack Benny Model. Comedy is rude. Tell me a funny joke that’s funny that isn’t rude. There’s a difference between humor and comedy. Humor is not as offensive, but definitely not as funny.
